forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of showers and thunderstorms between 2am and 4am, then showers and thunderstorms. Cloudy. Low around 64, with temperatures rising to around 66 overnight. South southwest wind 20 to 25 mph, with gusts as high as 45 mph. Chance of precipitation is 80%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Thursday
forecast.detailedForecast: Showers and thunderstorms before 1pm, then a slight chance of showers and thunderstorms between 1pm and 2pm. Partly sunny. High near 66, with temperatures falling to around 56 in the afternoon. Southwest wind 15 to 30 mph, with gusts as high as 50 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

weather_report:
The night in Evanston is heavy with clouds and the air is electric, with a chance of showers and thunderstorms rolling in from the south. As the clock ticks past two in the morning, the temperature hangs around a mild 64 degrees, with an increase as the night progresses. Winds are formidable tonight, reaching up to 45 mph, creating an ominous and turbulent ambiance. Look out for rain, as forecasters indicate significant precipitation is likely, with amounts potentially exceeding half an inch by dawn.

As Thursday dawns, this trend of unsettled weather will continue. The morning will see more showers and thunderstorms, but a glimmer of hope may emerge into the early afternoon with a slight chance of breaks in precipitation. The high expected is near 66, but temperatures are forecast to fall as the day wears on, leaving a distinctly cool vibe by afternoon, more typical of fall. The winds will remain strong, gusting up to 50 mph, making for a blustery outing if one ventures outside. Dressing in layers, equipped with a waterproof jacket and sturdy footwear, would be wise for those brave souls considering a walk along the beach or park.

With these conditions lingering, a cozy morning at home, perhaps with a warm beverage and a good book, might be the perfect remedy. If the rain abates, an afternoon stroll is a possibility—just watch your step on the wet paths. The day is a reminder that autumn in Evanston can swing from tranquility to turbulence, showcasing the changing seasons in all their glory.
